author: NASS
description:
I colorized, restored, and created a sound design for this video, which offers a rare glimpse of everyday life in Oklahoma during the 1920s. Captured in the towns of Boley, Clearview, and Taft, the footage reveals vibrant Black communities filled with pride and resilience — people walking through lively streets, attending church gatherings, children at school, and families enjoying daily life in thriving, self-sustaining towns of the era.

Video Restoration Process:
✔ FPS boosted to 60 frames per second 
✔ Image resolution boosted up to HD 
✔ Improved video sharpness and brightness 
✔ Colorized only for the ambiance (not historically accurate)
✔added sound only for the ambiance
✔restoration:(stabilisation,denoise,cleand,deblur) 

Please, be aware that colorization colors are not real and fake, colorization was made only for the ambiance and do not represent real historical data.

B&W Video Source: Solomon Sir Jones


Solomon Sir Jones (1869–1936) was a Baptist minister and filmmaker w
title: Oklahoma 1920s in color, Boley, Clearview, Taft [60fps, Remastered, Sound Design]
